title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of passengers using variables, $32 as x and $26 as (40-x).

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the number of each ticket type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their monetary values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{32}\left(x\right)+\operatorname{26}\left(40-x\right)=1196$$.

title: Substitution
text: Plug x into the original relationship to find 40-x.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is 26 passengers paying $32 and 14 passengers paying $26.
